title: Are Champion Rank Rewards weighted against Support? No S of any form, No chests
body:
Just curious how individual champion rankings work for support.
I find myself getting final scores, like 0/3/21 with Soraka or 3/2/25 with Braum for example, and receiving no S of any form. Not even a minus.
And therefore no chest. No reward.

I am a Support main, but am finding myself asking "Why? There is literally no reward for good performance."
Main Supports are fewer in number than any other type of player, followed by Top and ADC.

Are Chest Rewards for kills? If so, how does that help Supports? - We get harassed for most kills outside of teamfights.
Am I just not performing well enough to earn them?

I am lucky IF I get ONE PER WEEK!
What is going on? Is it me?

replies.body: I'm not aware of any weighted grading systems based on role.  There just may be other players performing better than that champion in that role.  I don't have additional grading information to share beyond what's in our [champion mastery](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204211284-Champion-Mastery-Guide) guide.  Keep at it!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=EMaAeOKs,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-14T00:33:30.417+0000)
>
> I'm not aware of any weighted grading systems based on role.  There just may be other players performing better than that champion in that role.  I don't have additional grading information to share beyond what's in our [champion mastery](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204211284-Champion-Mastery-Guide) guide.  Keep at it!

I plan to.

Yet, I have to disagree against weighting.
If my performance is compared to other players of that same champ in that same role - I am competing against the most specialized players in the smallest player pool that play this game.
With that in mind, it seems the game does not encourage diversity of champions but specialization instead because the reward for diversity is harder to achieve.

This means Support Mains can't really diversify until higher elo or must trudge slowly through various champs with no hope of getting higher elo in what is already a very slow climb - this hurts team a picks, even when looking at champs with similar kits that may be more useful than one's you have ranks in.

I will keep at it. But to say it's not weighted is a fallacy. Supports are weighted against each other in this system, and it seems not encouraged to diversify.

In a way it's more difficult to get an S on certain supports just because of how they are. Grading system takes account of damage dealt and creep score. On supports that don't deal much damage and on top of that aren't last hitting, it is much  more difficult to get an S.

Try increasing your CS count. This generally will improve your Grades greatly, because  most of the time Supports do not CS very well. They often top out at 1 cs/min.  Outfarm that, and you're well on your way.

#kappa
I'm a Braum main and I have little to no issue getting an S. I did at first, but then I improved as a player in order to get rewards.

I can get S- games, no problem as support. At least on my mains, that is. Though I DID just get an S- on Janna that I haven't touched in... ages, going 1/6/30.

Question is, have you already gotten an S on Soraka? An S on Braum? You can only unlock a chest on a champ once per season. If you've already gotten a chest on Soraka, you can't get one again for the rest of the season. Also, you can only get key fragments for wins (no matter what grade).
